gui.common
Class View

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  gui.common.View
All Implemented Interfaces:
IView, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
Direct Known Subclasses:
DialogView, InventoryView
public abstract class View
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements IView

View is a base class that provides common functionality required by all views in the program (i.e., view classes extend View instead of JPanel).

The functionality provided by View to its subclasses includes:

  • A reference to the owning GUI object
  • A reference to the view's controller
  • A facility for turning off event notifications when user interface components are being programmatically updated
  • Methods for displaying various types of messages to users
  • Utility methods for creating fonts, borders, and other UI objects.
  • An abstract method interface that must be supported by all subclasses
  • A template method that defines a standard algorithm for constructing subclass instances

Subclasses should override the following methods:

  • createComponents
  • layoutComponents

Subclasses should also call construct from their constructors. Subclass constructors should also initialize the view's controller;

See Also:
Serialized Form

Creates a font.

Parameters:

PRE:

POST:

createTableColumn

                                                              java.lang.String columnTitle,
                                                              int size)
Creates a table column.

Parameters:
columnIndex - Index for the new table column.
columnTitle - Title text for the new table column.
size - font size for the column title.
PRE:
columnIndex >= 0, columnTitle != null, size > 0
POST:
Returns a new table column with the specified column index, title, and title font size.

construct

protected void construct()
This is a template method that defines the construction process for all subclasses. Subclasses should call this method from their constructors in order to properly initialize themselves.
PRE:
None
POST:
The components for this view have been created and lain out on the panel.

createComponents

protected void createComponents()
Creates and initializes the components that populate this view. This method should only create/initialize the component objects, but not actually add them to the panel. Laying out the components on the panel is done by the layoutComponents method.
PRE:
None
POST:
The components for this view have been created

layoutComponents

protected void layoutComponents()
Lays out components on the view.
PRE:
None
POST:
The components for this view have been lain out on the panel

disableEvents

protected boolean disableEvents()
Disables events in this View if they are not already disabled.
PRE:
None
POST:
Returns true if events were disabled. Returns false if events were already disabled.

enableEvents

protected boolean enableEvents()
Enables events in this View.
PRE:
eventsAreDisabled() == true
POST:
Returns true if events were enabled. Returns false if events were already enabled.

eventsAreDisabled

protected boolean eventsAreDisabled()
Indicates whether or not events are DISABLED in this View.
PRE:
None
POST:
Returns true if events are disabled. Returns false if events are enabled.
